alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 1:27PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rio Grande, southern Mineral and northwestern Conejos Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 126 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a developing cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Wolf Creek Pass to 17 miles south of Del Norte. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Platoro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
